IRM 6.630.4.5.1(3) clariﬁes that telework employees are required to take reasonable steps to become telework-ready, and the manager may authorize travel during duty time to obtain necessary work equipment or ﬁles to enable employees to become telework-ready.
IRM 6.630.4.5.1(6) adds that employees who are required to telework will not have their scheduled telework days changed or cancelled.

IRM 6.630.4.5.5.3(1)(e) clariﬁes, for employees participating in the IRS Telework Program, the early departure policy when employees working in the office leave prior to the time set for dismissal due to circumstances that could prevent safe travel home, adds an example, and clariﬁes time and attendance posting instructions.

IRM 6.630.4.5.5.3(3)(c) clariﬁes leave (or other paid time off) policy when it is scheduled to begin at or after an early departure time and is rescinded by the employee because its intended purpose is frustrated by the same emergency that closes the office.
